website_summaries.verdict: Basic microfiber sheet set that comes in a plethora of colors. A good set for the guest room.
pros: Incredibly soft upon opening and after a few washes
Thin, silky feel reduces bed bulk
Still breathable and cool in hot weather
cons: Pilling is a problem after a few washes

customer_reviews.title: Bed bug infested - DO NOT PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these sheets in Sep 2018. I have seen a couple of similar reviews with this same experience during that time, so maybe we just got a really bad fluke. But this was absolutely horrifying. Didn’t wash them before I put them on the bed, cause I was too cheap to pay to to wash em, I’ll never make that mistake again. After we noticed some itching, decided to wash them to see this. The sheets them self were good quality, but this has been a very expensive, disgusting, horrifying purchase. Don’t buy these. Let this photo make you want to throw up and look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: kiera walker

customer_reviews.title: Not a good buy
customer_reviews.text: These sheets feel soft when they arrive and also after the first laundering. It was fun to put these new sheets on the bed. Then came the problems. The sheets are so thin that the bottom sheet can't possibly stay flat, so the result is a wrinkly bed all the time. Then they started to pill. I washed them in cold water and dried them on low, but still they pill. There are tiny crumbs everywhere, including on the bedroom floor. These sheets are not worth buying. AmazonBasics does not mean Amazon's Best, or even Mediocre.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Go With A Different Brand
customer_reviews.text: I have had these sheets for 6 months and they are already worn and pilly. The top sheet is so rough that I can feel the pills against my skin. I am so disappointed with these sheets. I should have went with the Utopia brand or these from Sweet Home Collectionbecause they continue to feel soft and comfortable. These two brands of sheets I have had for several years and they have held up wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: MaggieTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Mold
customer_reviews.text: I’m absolutely disgusted. I found what seems to be black mold on the pillow cases when opening.
customer_reviews.author: pam

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: So these aren't high end sheets, but for the cost, they are well worth the buy. I own 3 sets of these sheets and they've all held up very well. It's fits my 14 in deep queen foam mattress without issue. It's not too warm in the summer and still has the ability to help you keep warm in the winter. They feel pretty good. No, they won't feel like 850 thread count Egyptian cotton, it's these are a fraction of the cost. For the price, you can't go wrong purchasing these.
customer_reviews.author: Wathan48

customer_reviews.title: Thin sheets, dont understand the good reviews
customer_reviews.text: Not at all impressed. Especially disappointed because I did so much research and read reviews and these sheets got the best reviews in the price range I was looking for. I bought them to cover my sleeper sofa because I have a toddler that loves to destroy nice things so I didn't want to spend a fortune. But they're super thin and not even that soft. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have micro fiber sheets that I love but needed some for the twin bed in spare ...
customer_reviews.text: These were supposed to be micro fiber sheets, they are simply cheap polyester sheets with no softness at all. I have micro fiber sheets that I love but needed some for the twin bed in spare room. Not at all like the ones I have for king size I got at Costco. Sadly Costco did not have them in single size. These are a huge disappointment. Could have got these ones at discount store for less.
customer_reviews.author: Corrine Russell

customer_reviews.title: They hide the drool stains on my pillows perfectly
customer_reviews.text: They're great. I mean, what do you say about pillow cases? They hide the drool and head grease stains on my pillows perfectly. The fabric is comfortable to touch, and the stitching and construction were unremarkable, which means they got the job done as expected.
customer_reviews.author: D. Michael McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Dont recommend gray stripe and they pill
customer_reviews.text: Ive bought these sheets before in different colors, this time I got the gray stripe, only the gray is actually BEIGE. Does not match the comforterss I got. For some reason these sheets are more satiny, shiny than soft cottony like the other solid color I got in same brand. Sending them back. Also they are great sheets at first but the pill terribly before 6 months. They also stretch so bad they pull off the mattress. I own 3 pairs but looking for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonjunkie

customer_reviews.title: Not as soft as I was going for- would not recommend buying
customer_reviews.text: Bought two orders of the same type of microfiber pillow cases- different merchants. Found this to be lacking quality and softness compared to the other order from a different merchant. Price was better than the other, but I would spend more for softness. Would be same price or less at a box store like Target, Home goods, etc.
customer_reviews.author: kelly loves the beach

customer_reviews.title: So soft and comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and attractive. Super soft and comfortable, a nicer feel than my high thread count cotton pillowcases.
customer_reviews.author: sequoiaevergreen

customer_reviews.title: Nice pillowcases but be careful
customer_reviews.text: I like these pillowcases. However, I only gave 4 stars because I ordered spa blue, but received green. The green is pretty, but not what I ordered. I won't order the blue now, though, because I'm not sure what I would receive.
customer_reviews.author: Joya

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 9 Days
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my son to use in his dorm room on the twin XL size dorm bed. Upon receipt I washed them one time. On day nine of use the sheets were filled with pills. They were washed again and on second use the pilling was immediately worse. These have not even been used a total of one month yet and they are being thrown into the trash. I cannot recommend microfiber sheets. We are going back to 100% cotton sheets. There is something wrong with fabric sheets that only lasts nine nights sleep! Terrible low quality = 1 Star.
customer_reviews.author: ChristineMM

customer_reviews.title: Great Wrinkle-Free Pillow Cases
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous - absolutely no wrinkles. We use a lot of pillows on our bed. I recently purchased a new comforter set and needed brown pillow cases to match the spread and shams. These are perfect. If you need pillow cases that are both soft and wrinkle-free look no further. Oh, and the price was spot on!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Really cheap, flimsy linens
customer_reviews.text: Curses! Tricked by the reviews again! These sheets are as thin as tissue paper and have a slick, plastic feel to them. I got these for an air mattress used infrequently but I would be embarrassed to ask a guest to sleep on them. I should have known better than to expect decent sheets for so cheap, so shame on me. I guess all the people who have rated them highly have really low standards in bed linens. Spend a few more dollars and get some nice inexpensive cotton sheets. Mine are going straight into the Goodwill box.
customer_reviews.author: gingero

customer_reviews.title: Free skin exfoliation every time you roll over.
customer_reviews.text: Pilling badly after only two washes. I liken the softness to a piece of 100 grit sand paper. I'm reminded of my poor purchasing decision every time I roll over in bed. Normally the reviews on Amazon don't steer you in the wrong direction...... I plan on returning these.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Ridicously THIN
customer_reviews.text: Ridiculously THIN. By all of the great reviews, I was hoping for at least slightly better quality. Not even sure that I will make my bed with these. Very disappointed. (In the photo, you can clearly see my blinds behind the flat sheet - color light gray) UPDATE: after washing the very first time, I see the same oily spots that others mentioned. I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap garbage
customer_reviews.text: I read through the reviews. I decided to take a chance. Yeah, don't buy these. Washed them before use following directions on label. Put them on the bed. They were thin, and cheap. You get what you pay for. The worst part though is that there is no elasticity in the fitted sheet. Maybe I got a defective set, or is there just not supposed to be any elastic in it? It won’t stay on the bed. Which is honestly, the only responsibility a sheet has. I ordered it in purple. So please comment if you had a similar experience because maybe there was a bad batch that didn’t get the elastic sewn in? Lol.
customer_reviews.author: Ijustneedit

customer_reviews.title: Can't really expect much from $20 Sheets...
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what I was thinking because what can you really expect from $20 sheets? Upon reading all the good reviews for this product I was excited about getting these sheets for our new bed, but it did not live up to the expectations. The sheets are super thin (which is fine i guess) but has a cheap feel. Like a really cheap feel. I used to buy 600+ thread count sheets so you can for sure notice the difference. Will not buy these agin.
customer_reviews.author: supyoga11

customer_reviews.title: Soft but feel really cheap and artificial
customer_reviews.text: I bought the lavender paisley pattern set. The pattern is adorable but oh man do these feel cheap. They’re soft but they don’t stretch well over my mattress — and it’s not like I have a bed that requires deep-pocketed sheets. There’s just something very weirdly artificial about them. I’ve washed them a bunch of times and that artificial feel just doesn’t go away.
customer_reviews.author: NN

customer_reviews.title: NOT MICROFIBER!!
customer_reviews.text: Microfiber is soft fuzzy material. These are the same material as your typical bedsheets. Will be returning. Super disappointed. I have issues with textures and materials especially when it comes to bedding which is why I ordered microfiber pillowcases. Did not get what was advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Sheets!!
customer_reviews.text: Loved these sheets, so much so, I bought another set in a different color. Big mistake. Clasic example of "you get what you pay for." I personally expect sheets to last longer than seven months! When I went to change the sheets tonight, I was totally flaberghasted to find a huge tear, run, worn through spot underneath my husband's pillow and about the same size. Had the hole been at the foot of the bed, then I'd pass it off to ragged toenails and be considerably less unhappy! But, under a pillow? A pillow of a a person who, once he's alseep, never moves all night?? Will NOT be buying this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Hallie

customer_reviews.title: RUN AWAY FASTER
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give this product zero stars. I wasn't organized enough to return this with haste, it was a bad moment in my life. As soon as I opened it and touched the fabric, I knew I had purchased garbage. It's plasticky tight cotton. Maybe it needs 100 rounds through the wash to soften up? I wanted something to give off that cool summer cotton feel. This is absofreakinglutely NOT that. Oh, and the "full" size is most definitely just a twin sold-as, and that's a tough fit. F*** you, Amazon. These sheets are crap.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Look

customer_reviews.title: Pillowcases are good, delivered on time
customer_reviews.text: Pillowcases are good, delivered on time, packed in a box. Very gentle and smooth, but hot, unfortunately, therefore 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Is NOT sized for extra-long bed, nor are corners sewn correctly
customer_reviews.text: This item must have been sewn by Ray Charles after smoking crack. The corners are not sewn correctly, nor is the item made for an extra-long mattress, despite being advertised as being such. When two corners of the bed are matched up, the other two are way off. I'd figured, "Oh. Maybe I have the fitted sheet sideways? Ok. Let's turn the sheet 90 degrees and try it that way." Nope. Still the fitted sheet was off. I had already washed the sheet, so I am unable to return it. It's soft, but that's the only redeeming quality it has.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Good Product. Color holds. I'm a guy. Why should I care about sheets
customer_reviews.text: First I have purchased a couple sets of the Peachy Coral Arrows sheets Twin XL. I have purchased 3 different colors, blue, beige and mustard yellow of the Amazon Basics Microfiber Sheet Sets.. Two sets of each. They are all have been great purchases. They are a very good product. I highly recommend. Now why should I care about sheets. My wife has Parkinson's and I had to separate out twin beds that was a Cal King so that she could be taken care of easier. So I felt that she should have sheets colors that she would enjoy. So the Peachy Coral Arrows and the other colors. She really gave me a huge smile. It made my very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Alvin D Reed Sr

customer_reviews.title: Great For 3 Months
customer_reviews.text: After reading all of the positive reviews, I ordered these sheets the end of June 2019. They were like a very soft satin and so comfortably cool for sleeping. I loved them for 3 months. After daily use and washing once or twice weekly they suddenly started pilling like no sheet I've ever seen. I could feel the pills on my skin! Of all the sheets I remember having, from cheap to expensive, these are the first sheets I've ever had trouble with pilling. They are cheap enough to replace once the pilling starts but I'd rather find another brand with the same cool silky satin feel that would hold up for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis

customer_reviews.title: Like whatever machine they washed them in before packaging them ...
customer_reviews.text: The sheets that I ordered came with stains on them. Like whatever machine they washed them in before packaging them had something sticky on the inside of the machine and it rubbed off on the sheets. I went to return them, and they don’t even do free returns for their own stuff! Ridiculous. I will definitely think twice before purchasing amazon basics again. I now have sheets I will probably never use, but I’m not paying half of their original cost to ship them back. I do not recommend these sheets
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Bent

customer_reviews.title: Started off well, then got pilly after a couple of months.
customer_reviews.text: My review went from a 4 to a 2. When I first bought these sheets, they were super comfortable, inexpensive, and fit nicely. But after a couple of months of use, they became very pilly, as in the fabric is coming up to form little, annoying balls of thread. I can feel patches of pills around where my legs usually lay. My super soft, comfy sheets just became bumpy and obnoxious. While these sheets were certainly cheap, I think it's worth it to spend a little more to get sheets that stay soft and smooth. Mysheets have stayed nice for much longer than these AmazonBasics sheets, and they're only $5 more.
customer_reviews.author: RachelS

customer_reviews.title: Pill quickly
customer_reviews.text: Not good sheets. Within 3-4 months the fitted sheet was badly pilled and very uncomfortable... a couple months later the flat sheet was in the same state. I'm glad they were cheap - but if I have to buy new sheets 2-3 times a year might as well spend $60 on a sheet set that will last longer.
customer_reviews.author: D. G. Luchetti

customer_reviews.title: Thin, soft, a little large
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so first off, very soft. But they are thin and I didn't expect that. They aren't see through, but it makes it feel cheap because they are so thin. Which, they are money cheap, but so are most of the packs sold on Amazon. They also are a little big for my standard sized pillows...Which is disappointing. I first ordered the light grey and it was WAY too light. The dark blue were just like the photo.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa D. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Do It!!!
customer_reviews.text: Infected with bugs. I opened the package to wash them and noticed how soft the sheets where. When I shook the sheets out to put them in the washer thousand of little black bugs came out. Both sheets were full of bugs!!! Immediately tossed both into the washer on HOT water and sprayed everything I would find on all the bugs that were scattered everywhere in my laundry room.
customer_reviews.author: Korbar

customer_reviews.title: Soft
customer_reviews.text: I'd give it 5 stars, but I'm still giving it time to see how long they last, so far I'm at roughly 8 months on my first set of constant wear with no problems. For whatever reasons, over the years my lower legs have grown sensitive to rough sheets. I've tried various types, but of them all so far these seem to the most comfortable overall and amazingly cheap compared to others. I bought one set to try out towards the end of 2018, they've been holding up well so far and feel like a soft flannel. I've recently ordered another set.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Borich

customer_reviews.title: not the color i chose
customer_reviews.text: this is really the only bad review i’ve ever left. i’m honestly quite upset just because i’ve been wanting to finally have my bed and room put together. i was wanting yellow. like the color that is being shown. i understand the fine print when it said color may not be quite exact but this is way off. this should be considered tan or beige. the color is still within my scheme and is usable however it’s more about expecting the color that is being advertise and receiving something totally different. i chose and payed for what i’m seeing. if it was tan or beige then i wouldn’t have paid or picked it. i’m annoyed. just be aware when purchasing
customer_reviews.author: Yasmine Al-Assi

customer_reviews.title: Very nice sheet sets
customer_reviews.text: Just received my second order of these wonderful sheet sets. The fitted sheet overlaps the sides nicely and hugs the corners just right. Works quite well during the winter. No idea how these will handle heat during the summer yet. Pillow case is sized perfectly in my opinion. There's enough length to it that the open end covers itself so the pillow isn't exposed, keeping the color continuity of the bed/set intact. So far, these are super soft and comfortable to sleep in. The color choices are great too. Have 2 sets so far and plan on buying 2 more for color variety. Would definitely recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Mark K

customer_reviews.title: Poorest quality sheets
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, I can only say these were just a waste of my money. I washed and dried them upon receiving them using delicate/low heat cycles and they came out with many thread pulls. I didn't bother putting them on the bed because it seemed clear that they would quickly rip in those locations. I put them back in the box but it wasn't worth paying the postage to send them back. I am really disappointed in the quality. They were inexpensive but I can still think of other things I would rather have spent my money on than throwing my money away.
customer_reviews.author: NGraham

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Stained
customer_reviews.text: Both mattress cover and bed sheets were stained when arrived with an oily looking substance. Washing did not remove the stain. Sheets appear to be of nice quality if they hadn't been stained apparently during the manufacturing process. Unfortunately, I did not open the package until after the 30 day return period so appear to be stuck with them. I have purchased Amazon Basic products/sheets in the past with no problem - hopefully Amazon is reading reviews of their product and address their manufacturing problem. I am a big Amazon fan and regularly purchase products from Amazon with very few problems so hopefully this is not a trend.
customer_reviews.author: ACustomer

customer_reviews.title: Nice color, soft sheets
customer_reviews.text: Washed them in cold water, dried on low (only took 20 min) with a soft dryer sheet. Came out with no wrinkles but had a stain in one place. Washed them again and dried them WITHOUT the soft dryer sheet and there were NO STAINS and no wrinkles. The only beef I have with them is that they bunch up every night and have to be tucked in again. I ordered some cheap stretchy bed sheet straps for the corners which I heard really work well to hold them in place. Frosty lavender is exactly the same color which is refreshing. Pillowcases are standard with no pocket and no embellishment. I am pretty impressed though for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jesgrate

customer_reviews.title: These Need Better Elastic.
customer_reviews.text: They're inexpensive. They're very soft. They come with 2 pillowcases. The (cream) color is a great basic. They wash and dry well. That's the good stuff. The basic (major) problem with these sheets is the elastic on the fitted sheet. It has almost no "grip" to it. It's weak, and does not hold the bottom sheet firmly to the mattress. So they pull up off the sides, become very wrinkled and tend to bunch up in spots (like under your hips). In any case, they're okay as a second set of sheets, but to rate 5 stars, they need major improvement on the quality of the elastic.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Painchaud-Steinman

customer_reviews.title: Uber soft and great quality!
customer_reviews.text: These sheets are so soft, fit a large 16 in mattress and the color is spot on! I will definitely be purchasing another set soon. Such a great price for what you get! Wasn’t super impressed with packaging as some people like to have a bag to keep sheets in. Doesn’t matter to me because I normally toss it away. Just know if you are gifting, it isn’t the best wrapped sheets and you may want to have them sent to you and then fancy up the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Healthy Oiling Mama

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: I've had a lot of luck with other AmazonBasics products, so I thought I would give this a try because of the great price. Don't even bother. They are very, very thin and feel cheap. After a few washes the fitted sheet has already gotten a hole. I would return these if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Breathable, soft, lovely and AFFORDABLE!
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly beautifully soft, breathable and visually appealing. It's been about a month of joy with these sheets. They wash up well and there is no pill. (A pill, colloquially known as a bobble, fuzzball, or lint ball is a small ball of fibers that forms on a piece of cloth. 'Pill' is also a verb for the formation of such balls. Pilling is a surface defect of textiles caused by wear, and is generally considered an undesirable trait.) I highly recommend these sheets. Looking forward to buying another set ext month. It would be nice to have several sets in different designs.
customer_reviews.author: House of Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my son's new bed
customer_reviews.text: My son did seem to like these they are quite bright he has a thing about ready even has a red light in his room he is grown not a child they seem to fit the new mattress perfectly even with a small foam topper a little over an inch in height they don't seem to wrinkle they're very soft I did feel them even though I'm not the one sleeping on them as far as staying resistant he doesn't eat in the bed, So we wouldn't know about that.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Dreams Are Made of These
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing like a beautiful bed with soft, dreamy sheets of sweet softness. I love these sheets! No, I do. I love the color although I don't think it's truly teal, but oh the softness! The feeling of it against the skin! The smoothness that makes you feel as if you're sleeping on a cloud! Yes, they are heavenly. I don't like scratchy, stiff sheets against my body. Who would? These sheets are worth every penny and I wouldn't mind purchasing more of them. I have not stained them so I can't attest to how easy they are to clean. They were wrinkled but smoothed out after a short time. As good as any I've ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Tempestj

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!
customer_reviews.text: I saw "microfiber" and thought of the cleaning cloths I got eons ago that I had to toss because they got snagged on everything. Well, this is NOT that microfiber! I ordered these for our guest bed on Deal Day because my houseguest at the time said she has them and loves them. I resisted, but then gave in because, after all, I'm not sleeping in that bed. :) Well, now I'm wishing that I'd gotten a set for our bed as well!
customer_reviews.author: C. L. Hansberry

customer_reviews.title: Cheap fabric but worth the price
customer_reviews.text: It has been exactly six months since I got these sheets. I've used and washed them regularly, yet they are already so uncomfortable to sleep on because of the fabric breaking down/wearing thin. Admittedly its only in one spot....where I sleep. It was only $20 so I think the quality is about on par with the price. If I were to purchase again I'd probably buy two so I could switch out my sheets even more, but at that point should you just buy better ones?? Idk but that's what I'm gonna do ✌🏻
customer_reviews.author: Savannah

customer_reviews.title: only complaint- 1 pillowcase
customer_reviews.text: No wrinkles, a few creases out the packaging but that was expected. I wish it came with 2 pillowcases instead of the one. a bit stiff but i didn't expect buttery smooth softness. i feel like after a wash or two it will get softer. i definitely will purchase more from this line. I plan to upgrade my bedroom and mattress this year and now i know i can trust this brand
customer_reviews.author: BeeOnAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Always a cool spot
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these on April 4th 2016 and since then I have purchased two other sheet sets, when this one is next in rotation I’m always a little happier because over 3 years later these still look new and I can always find a cool spot with these sheets which is one of the most important aspects for me with bedding. If it’s too warm sleep is nearly impossible. Sometimes these come off the bed and right back on after laundry which goes against my retail training . I should mention that cool spot is assisted by a fan but it’s still better than the other sets I’ve purchased since
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Pilled like crazy almost immediately, not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned these sheets for hardly any time at all, and they started pilling almost immediately, but only on the part that I sleep on. I follow the wash instructions, but it is clearly just caused by using them literally for what they were made for, which is frustrating. These are honestly not even worth the $16 that I paid for them.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: Mixed Reviews
customer_reviews.text: I bought these sheets for my 20 yr old son. He doesn't like them- he says they feel cheap. I put them on our bed. My husband said he likes them- he doesn't stick to them when he turns over. I think they seem cheap (thin) but I bought them and know how low end they are- would I feel the same if I didn't know how little I paid for them? So mixed reviews from our house. ** We've been using them for a year & they are in the same condition, so they are wearing well.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie33569

customer_reviews.title: Um. Not quite...
customer_reviews.text: These sheets feel soft to the touch; however, I received 1 fitted sheet and 9 pillow cases! YES: 9 pillowcases and 1 fitted sheet, no top sheet. I feel this is so rediculous I am not even returning this, I will use the fitted sheet, not even the pillow cases because they are HUGE. So, I basically paid for a fitted sheet.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality sheets at a nice price
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t sure if I would like these sheets since I’m kind of a sheet snob. I normally buy Egyptian cotton with a high thread count for durability and softness, but needed to buy several new sheet sets for my kid’s room so the affordable price was a huge plus. I was looking for a darker purple to go with the outer space themed duvet and pillow shams I also ordered from Amazon and these plum sheets are a nice complement to them. I was very surprised by how nice they actually are, and they have held up well so far to frequent washing. My kid really likes them too.
customer_reviews.author: maggiesmama

customer_reviews.title: Not for Me
customer_reviews.text: These sheets are super soft and silky feeling. They are also very, very light weight and thin. They wouldn't stay paired with the blanket and I was always fixing the top sheet. The fitted sheet doesn't fit my mattress very well, but I do have an 8" mattress, so maybe it would fit a thicker mattress better. I actually ended up just taking off the top sheet and only using the fitted sheet temporarily until I could order different sheets. I prefer a cottony feel, and a heavier sheet that stays in place. That said, the seams all seem fine and they seem to be made well, and they washed well.
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: Great color, uncomfortably smooth.
customer_reviews.text: I had no problem with these, but boyfriend refused to sleep in them and described the texture as "slippy". I will say they are VERY smooth, like constantly having to adjust the fitted sheet back onto the mattress kind of smooth. If you don't mind smooth bedding, and the fitted sheet wrinkling under you from excess material moving around, these are a good affordable option. Since boyfriend refuses to sleep in them, I will be turning them into curtains. The color is BEAUTIFUL.
customer_reviews.author: Kenna Denny

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sheets at amazing price
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy from anywhere else. These sheets hold up beautifully and are soft as heck. You don't sweat but you're not cold. Fit it perfect. I have two sets for each bed in the house now (we have 6 beds). I threw all the other sheets away. We change our sheets every Saturday so it works out great. I especially love the fact that i'm not paying an arm and a leg for a product that is going to loose it's elasticity, get those awful bumps on them and just not hold up as well.
customer_reviews.author: Avid reader

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these pillow cases as they seemed like a good deal. I always wash my bedding before use. I followed the instructions on the tag and these pillow cases came apart at the seams between the wash and dry cycle. Upon further inspection I found the stitching throughout both pillow cases was not done correctly. I wasn’t expecting top of the line pillow cases for the price, but I was expecting something that resembled a pillow case and not project or a rag. The Amazon Basic Products have been good in the past which is why I choose this product, but not this time, it was a total fail. Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sheets pill badly and become scratchy, check out the one and two star reviews
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand how this product has high reviews. I usually base a lot of my purchases after carefully reading the reviews so I bought these without hesitation, but these sheets are the absolute worse I've ever had. After only washing/drying twice, they have already started to pill very badly, making them very scratchy. It's a shame, because I did like the color and appearance of these sheets. Look elsewhere as you will regret this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: S.B. Powell

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a couple of these sheets for my nephews as a gift. They are strange little boys in that they love getting bed sheets as a present. I purchased these for the price based on the fact that boys (at least my nephews) are, in fact, grubby little creatures and will soil their sheets in no time with dirt, etc. I did not want to pay a high price for sheets that will just be stained from little boy grubbies in a years time. The brand new appearance is appealing, even if the touch quality is not super high. However, I believe these sheets will be comfortable for them to snuggle up in and enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: HobbsGal

customer_reviews.title: Horrible quality
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews I decided to give these sheets a try. Here it is 4 months later and we’re about to throw them away. I ordered the white and they’re somewhat sheer but the real issue is the quality of the fabric. It’s thin and with use the fabric has started piling a TON. There are little tiny balls of fabric all over the sheets in the areas we sleep in. They look horrible and I am now on the search for new sheets.
customer_reviews.author: Jessgt

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Purchase these sheets on March 30 and we were SO excited for them given the price, reviews, recs. However, these just do not hold up past 2-3 months. They are now EXTREMELY scratchy, pilling, and downright not good. I will disclose that I DID follow correct care instructions and that we didn’t do anything to compromise the sheets. They’re literally just crappy sheets 😂 However, if you need some cheap sheets for a guest room that doesn’t get used very often... I suppose these would be an economical option. They look fine once the bed is made.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Just OKAY
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for $20. I have some much nicer microfiber sheets for $25. These are soft. I got the Spa Blue, which is a very nice color. Calming and soft blue. However... the downside is the "shedding" little balls from these sheets! The feeling of these little "ball" bumps is intolerable and annoying. I have had to flip the sheet around different ways to get it to where I don't feel them; I'm not sure what causes this. It is like tiny bits of fabric that shed off and stick to the sheets as little rough balls. Otherwise, they are good sheets. Next time, I will spend the $5 extra to get some much nicer sheets.
customer_reviews.author: E. White

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I decided to buy these sheets after careful consideration. I am extremely picky about sheets. I have used the same set for years because i couldn't find any others that didn't come off during the night as i am a restless sleeper. I also can't stand the feeling of anything but cotton sheets. These sheets did not come off amd even though they are not cotton they feel like they are. As of right now I am very pleased with my purchase and will buy these in different colors
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice sheets, great price.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second set of these sheets and honestly, I love them. They have been a great value for the money, and have held up well. I wash in cold and dry on low heat and have had no issues at all with the quality or color holding up. I recently purchased mustard yellow but would call it more of a "goldenrod." I thought it would be more like yellow mustard color, but it is a warmer, more subdued shade of yellow, which I prefer as it is a nice match to the yellow accents in our new bedspread. I find these to be a great product and would definitely recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Deezy

customer_reviews.title: Pills really bad after only 4 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought the gray queen sized sheets, wash them like I've washed every other set of sheets I've had before. They were decently soft at first, but now they aren't at all. They have pilled terribly! I've never had this problem with sheets before. My previous sheets were 6 years old and still have no pills to this day, and they were $30, AND from a freaking county fair kiosk. I expect better from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Richelle

customer_reviews.title: Very Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: The blue striped sheets suck. Forget being super soft, they aren’t soft whatsoever. They are very loud and scratchy on the skin. They also are not a good fit and are always wrinkled. Can’t get them to stay flat. I gave them a few washes I hopes they needed to be broken in. But nope, they sill suck! My return window is now closed so I’m stuck with theM, but don’t make the same mistake!!
customer_reviews.author: E&J

customer_reviews.title: Love the solids, not the printed
customer_reviews.text: I have several sets of the un-patterned amazon basics sheets that I love. They’re super soft, they breathe well, and the price is fantastic. I bought this set of patterned sheets, and they feel like a totally different material. I don’t know if it is because they have the pattern, or if it’s because the material in the sheets changed. Either way, these are stiff, don’t breathe, and honestly are uncomfortable. But they’re really cute. I ended up putting the fitted sheet on and using another top sheet and have been very happy with that. Regardless, love my original amazon basics sheets, don’t care for the patterned set I just got.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price but ultimately you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these sheets for a few months now. They are cheap and soft but you totally get what you pay for. Pros: price, durability, softness. Cons: slips up in corners, piling in certain areas to the point it feels like crumbs are in your bed after several washes. I would be willing to spend more for a higher quality sheet set. However, if you are on a budget, this is a good set for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Hafenstein

customer_reviews.title: Not long lasting
customer_reviews.text: At first I really enjoyed these sheets, however I have had them for less than a year and they have begun to pill up badly. I have a similar set of sheets priced the same from Walmart that have held up twice as long. For the price they're ok, but if you expect to have them for longer than a short time or for occasional use you might be better off buying something else
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Sandiego

customer_reviews.title: The Worst
customer_reviews.text: These are honestly the worst sheets I’ve ever used. I washed before using, and they looked nice enough. However, the cheap fabric (NOT microfiber) was not soft in any way. In fact, they are unexplainably slippery, and the elastic on the fitted sheet doesn’t stay on the mattress where it’s supposed to be. I’m constantly fighting them, and even after 6 weeks or so of use, I don’t see any improvement. Every time I roll over, the gusset on the fitted sheet pops off the mattress and I wind up wrapped in a sheet burrito. Spend a few extra dollars and get something made with cotton.
customer_reviews.author: Terirose22

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: These sheets are cheap, cheap, cheap. I expected them to be similar to other microfiber sheets I own. These are bottom shelf Walmart quality. I would rather sleep on 100 thread count pre-packaged matching blanket and sheet from the dusty caverns of a second hand store than ever sleep on these again. The King size is way too short as well, and rolls up from my mattress. Spend 3-10 more dollars and buy a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Yates

customer_reviews.title: Surprised the hell out of me!
customer_reviews.text: First, let me say that this review is written by a male that has no real observatory powers on the quality of sheets. That being said, I am just not picky. We needed sheets for new beds at a new house we purchased. The house was pricey so we needed something inexpensive that could cover the new bed. These sheets not only met they exceeded expectations. I simply love them. The cost/benefit ratio cannot be denied here. I enjoy them.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. R

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Color and Super Soft!
customer_reviews.text: These are nice cases for the price, and very soft, and very thin—which we prefer cases to be on soft feather pillows. We were happily surprised at how true the color is to the image on the product page, because we really (REALLY) wanted this precise blue as it matches one of the walls in our guest room. Can't yet speak to how well they hold up in the wash because we haven't used them yet, but we've a set of sheets made of similar material and those have made it through several washings just fine. If they somehow fall apart after a couple washes I'll edit the review. But for now we're considering buying another pair.
customer_reviews.author: KeeKee

customer_reviews.title: Light Weight but Great!
customer_reviews.text: These sheets may seem cheap out of the bag. In fact, I was concerned they’d be almost transparent against the mattress. I’m happy they weren’t. These sheets are remarkably light weight, so if you’re after winter cozy warmth, look elsewhere. I stay warm all year round and these are slick, cool and soft. My only critique is they’re so slick, the cases slide off the pillow, but that’s just being picky. They fit perfectly but never creep off the corners of my deep mattress. I recommend and will purchase more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Big bottom sheet- better for really thick mattresses. Good quality sheets though.
customer_reviews.text: Why four stars overall when ya’ rated everything else five stars, you ask? Well, these sheets are HUGE. I have a standard size queen mattress and the bottom sheet is constantly slipping and creasing up on the mattress. I bought the little clips Amazon sells to attach to the bottom sheet in hope they’d help. Those clips are a pain in the butt, and the bottom sheet is still slipping. The bottom sheet is better suited for a thick mattress. BUT, the sheets are thin and cool, soft, and the colors (I bought the flowered set in blue) are vivid and pretty. I’d buy these again...along with a roll of duct tape. Haha
customer_reviews.author: brewny

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value
customer_reviews.text: As we have dogs our sheets don't last very long from constant abuse (nails) and washing (dog hair). So we looked for something as a better value instead of huge thread count etc. These actually are amazing for the price, great value. We can get 3-4 sets for the price of one and hold up well enough. Instead of $100 for one set and last 6 months we get 5 sets and MAYBE wear out 2 in 6 months. so for the $100 we are set for a year and have many colors and change sheets every 3 days instead of one set for 6 months and wash every week.
customer_reviews.author: Jason K

customer_reviews.title: Keep shopping.
customer_reviews.text: I will admit the color (light blue) is very pretty. They are rather shiny tho. It’s ok. I’m a female and I kinda like it. They fit my mattress well. They are deep pocketed. I am not (deep pocketed) so that’s another reason I chose these sheets. That being said, they pill more than a pharmacy. It’s annoying. I have only used this set of sheets maybe three times. I know. You get what you pay for. These sheets would be amazing if you just use them when company spends the night. They are very soft. I’ve not had wrinkling issues at all. But the pilling. Oh my.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I have been shopping for sheets that would fit my King size bed and mattress topper and decided to try these. My mattress is 16 inches with my 3 inch mattress topper and these cover all the way around. I haven’t slept on them yet so I don’t know how they will hold up overnight but they seem to be snug enough. They are a soft, breathable cotton. ETA: After having slept on them a few days I can say they hang on well at the corners overnight but the sides do ride up. I suggest corner clips for these sheets. Still satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kaila

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sheets! They are so soft and have held ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sheets! They are so soft and have held up to our family. We have 2 dogs (50-60 lbs) who lounge on or in the bed when we aren't home and 2 little kids who are always crawling into bed and jump all over the bed. We have used them daily for close to a year now and get washed weekly. They are still in amazing shape and are so soft and comfortable! You can't been the quality of these sheets for the price! I will be ordering more in the future!
customer_reviews.author: LK28

customer_reviews.title: Good for non-mover sleepers
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful fabric. Almost a satin-y soft and kept cool during sleep. Live in the south and this is always a plus. The biggest issue is that because it is such a slick material, even with the deep pockets, the bottom sheet slips off of the bed in the corners. This happened after just one night of sleep. I am a relatively small woman and my husband is 6’5”, so I’m always looking for sheets that can withstand different weight movements in the evening without slipping off. These did not hold up to the test. If you are a non-mover sleeper, or sleep alone, these sheets will be perfect for you.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Review Your Mattress Thickness First...
customer_reviews.text: If you like a fitted sheet that is truly fitted, crisp and not constantly wrinkling around you, these are not for you. That is, unless you have an extremely deep, ultra-thick mattress and no other fitted sheet actually works. If you struggle with typical king size sheets that don’t identify as deep pocket- these are made for you. For me, and my semi-thick, pillow top mattress- these sheets were loose and while soft enough, somewhat annoying to deal with. Sadly, I will continue my hunt for the perfect bedsheets.
customer_reviews.author: BCPilgrimM1982

customer_reviews.title: Not Deep Enough
customer_reviews.text: I have a 16" mattress and these sheets don't come close to fitting. Every morning they are pulled away from the corners. They are comfortable but not deep enough.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Just the best sheets ever!!
customer_reviews.text: I love love love these sheets! I am a sucker for blue gingham and this microfiber is amazing! It's really soft. It keeps you cool in the summer and warm in the winter. It washes up like a dream (without all the wrinkles). The price on this set is out of this world wonderful too! I tell everyone I know about these AmazonBasics microfiber sheets because they are such a find!
customer_reviews.author: Amy M Schmitt

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: The two inserts that I ordered this time are the 4th and 5th that we have in our home. To say these inserts are worth every penny is an understatement. I have 4 young kids that, needless to say, get their bedding washed quite often. These are soft and comfortable right out of the packaging and somehow manage to get softer with each wash. They hold up well to 100s of washes, being dragged here and there, and never have shown wear. I highly suggest these to anyone looking for new duvet inserts and you can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: A. Maklowski

customer_reviews.title: My favorite sheets & I am picky!
customer_reviews.text: These sheets have deep pockets that fit my mattress with a memory foam topper. If you do not have a thick mattress or mattress with topper you may have excess fitted sheet. They are so soft & feel like brushed suede. I have washed several times & no pilling. I can't stand to crawl in my bed & feel those little balls all over my sheets. The price on these king size sheets is an added bonus. I love them so much that I bought my daughter some for Christmas. Nothing better than freshly washed sheets after a long stressful day. Go ahead, order them. You won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Penny Sosebee

customer_reviews.title: Super Soft and smooth without feeling cheap
customer_reviews.text: These are smooth to the touch but don't have that slippy zippy feeling that really cheap synthetic sheets have. The black is really deep and true to color, and hasn't faded after many washings (My son is prone to "accidents" right now.). I'm probably going to order some in a different color or my own bed because I am obsessed with the softness. They don't wrinkle in the dryer either, which is nice. So far no stains have been visible, but they are black so I'm not sure how much of it is that. Anyway these are really surprsingly great.
customer_reviews.author: Taj

customer_reviews.title: Pillowcase ripped after 2 uses
customer_reviews.text: I only used this sheet set twice for the bed inside of my camper and the pillowcase already ripped along the seam. They’re $20 sheets, so I’m not surprised. The sheets are still very soft and comfortable so I’m not going to return the set even though the one pillowcase is not usable anymore. If you’re looking for something durable, definitely look elsewhere. It’s a shame because I really do like how soft and lightweight the sheets are. I just won’t be able to have matching pillow cases if I use them from now on.
customer_reviews.author: nicole

customer_reviews.title: Soft but too much static
customer_reviews.text: I've never had microfiber sheets but wanted to give it a try. Positive: they are lightweight, very soft, and don't wrinkle. They are well priced. Negative: they don't wash as hot as cotton, there is so much static when drying, all other non cotton items (dress socks) get stuck on it. I noticed with the dark color sheets that white particles still cling to fabric surface even after washing. The microfiber also doesn't regulate body heat well. If you sweat they become hot and sticky. I would recommend them for a guest room but not for constant use.
customer_reviews.author: Grauzellen

customer_reviews.title: No Stains! Cheap! Soft! Not much wrinkles for Twin bed!
customer_reviews.text: Well... not much to talk about this product because Amazon Basics did it again and AGAIN! Cheap price, not much to negatively talk about, it serves its purpose and was just perfect. Even though I purchased a Cream color sheet it didn't get stained while I was using them. Unless you are living in a place where it gets super cold, then I would recommend you to get something more thicker sheet or the ones that has the fur with it if that's your preference, because this could have some lows on the strong winter weathers out there. But if that isn't the case, this is the perfect product and would not regret!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: They bunch up under your body
customer_reviews.text: These sheets feel soft when they arrive and also after the first laundering. It was fun to put these new sheets on the bed. Then came the problems. The sheets are so thin that the bottom sheet can't possibly stay flat, so the result is a wrinkly bed all the time. Then they started to pill. I washed them in cold water and dried them on low, but still they pill. There are tiny crumbs everywhere, including on the bedroom floor. These sheets are not worth buying. AmazonBasics does not mean Amazon's Best, or even Mediocre.
customer_reviews.author: jkhughes

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I ordered multiple sets of these sheets to line masks I plan to make and donate to children in homeless shelters. Since my budget is limited, I thought that this would be an inexpensive way to get soft fabric that would neither shrink not bleed. But these are so thin and rough compared to microfiber sheets that I have purchased elsewhere. Then I read about the pilling problem in the reviews, something that was never an issue with microfiber sheets I've owned for years & washed frequently. So these go back to Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Lininmotion

customer_reviews.title: Great at first...,3 months later NOT GOOD
customer_reviews.text: When I got these in Jan 2020.. I was up we pleased with them! Bright red.. they don’t bleed and are super silky soft... very comfortable! But.... now April 1st 2020 The fitted sheet is all piling and lil fuzz balls making it awful to sleep in... like there’s dirt or sand in the bed same as top sheet but isn’t as bad as the top sheet
customer_reviews.author: ShellyBeans

customer_reviews.title: Bugs on the sheets.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely disgusting that there were bugs in the bag.... I have never seen bugs like this so I have no idea what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Allie and Abel

customer_reviews.title: Not good for people who toss and turn all night
customer_reviews.text: So the sheets are decent and are a nice material and color however they just barely fit my 14 inch deep mattress and are constantly coming off of my bed at the corners. I toss and turn in the night but have never had an issue with my sheets coming off when I used a different brand. It's extremely frustrating. I do not want to have to go through the hassle of getting a sheet holder contraption as my mattress is heavy to lift and I change my sheets weekly. If you don't toss and turn a lot this probably won't be an issue for you.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Berninger

customer_reviews.title: Polyestery Feel but great color, no wrinkle, no stain
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to wash and use. Polyester feel so a bit slippery. If you like cotton sheets, DO NOT buy. If you like a soft, cool sheet that does not bunch up because it is sized perfectly for the Queen and the King bed, go for it. Looks great and colors are bright. Check is small and very pleasing.I would use it for a kid's room or guest bedroom...personally, I prefer the cotton sheets even if not as soft. Great option if you are more focused on easy washing, frequently using, not staining, not fading etc.
customer_reviews.author: Smart Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality Great value
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased these sheets before in different colors. They wash up nice are mostly wrinkle free and are very soft. I wash them before I use them. They seem to be of good quality. I wash them at least once a month since I have 4 sets and have had some for at least 4 years and they are still like new. I have not had any stains to deal with as of yet. These in particular are white with a sorta tanish silverish color diamond pattern. I think they could match with any color scheme because they are so versatile. I buy they sheets every time I need to buy sheets for myself or anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Schramfam

customer_reviews.title: Very nice feel so far.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. It feels soft but really thin. I can see thorough it easily! And just a bit on this side of a bright red. Color is really nice. I'm washing them now and I'll post an update after I put them on my bed tonight. I'll see if it lives up to the claims from the company. I'll update in a few days. They feel like silk. I have lupus and my skin sometimes gets hyper sensitive. When I was first diagnosed, silk was the only thing I could have against my skin. Wish they'd made these back then. Silk sheets are so expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Rowan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I really like these sheets, and not just for the affordable price (although that is certainly a draw). I needed Twin XL sheets in a hurry to fit a rental hospital bed so I took a chance and ordered them. They are super soft and don’t wrinkle at all. Because I always use a mattress pad, it doesn’t matter to me that they are thin. In fact I prefer it because they don’t require a long time in the dryer. still, I ordered a second set in dark teal so I can alway have clean sheets in the bed.
customer_reviews.author: R Hester

customer_reviews.title: Just be clear what you are expecting.
customer_reviews.text: The colors are quite nice. The material is soft but a bit thin and flimsy, which allows the case to easily slide around the pillow. But they were inexpensive, and I wasn’t looking for super high quality given the occasional intended use.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Ellington

customer_reviews.title: Not long lasting
customer_reviews.text: Overall good product soft and comfortable. Item is good size and fits as expected. At first could not believe quality and got 2 sets. After 5 months already have to replace they are pilling. I made sure I washed item carefully but same result every time.Very disappointed did not hold up very long.
customer_reviews.author: StarWarsNut

customer_reviews.title: should have gone with mellanni
customer_reviews.text: Ordered Mellanni microfiber sheets before and really liked them. Ordered these because I wanted a different pattern and they were less expensive. Should have gone with the other brand - these are fine and the pattern is cute, but they are very thin and make swishy noises like the plastic waterproof mattress pads on my kids beds. I would return them but already mailed a christmas gift in the box they came in. Overall not bad for an inexpensive backup sheet set but will not be my primary set.
customer_reviews.author: L
